sen.j: 山科 言継（やましな ときつぐ、永正4年4月26日 (旧暦)（1507年6月6日）-天正7年3月2日 (旧暦)（1579年3月28日））は、戦国時代 (日本)の公家で内蔵頭から権大納言に昇った。
sen.e: Tokitsugu YAMASHINA (June 6, 1507-March 28, 1579) was the court noble of Japan, and he promoted from Kura no kami (Chief of Kuraryo, Bureau of Palace Storehouses) to Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

Tokitsugu YAMASHINA (June 6, 1507-March 28, 1579) was a court noble of Japan, and was promoted from Kura no kami (Chief of Kuraryo, Bureau of Palace Storehouses) to Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

Tokitsugu YAMASHINA (June 16, 1507 - April 7, 1579) was a court noble of Japan, and was promoted from Kura no kami (Chief of Kuraryo, Bureau of Palace Storehouses) to Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) during the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。スペース補足しました。

sen.j: 父は山科言綱、子は山科言経、橘氏起源と変遷。
sen.e: His father was Tokitsuna YAMASHITA, and his child was Tokitsune YAMASHINA; Tachibana Clan
sen.cmt: 橘氏起源と変遷 の意味が不明のため訳出しておりません。
sen.e: His father was Tokitsuna YAMASHITA, and his child was Tokitsune YAMASHINA; Tachibana Clan
His father was Tokitsuna YAMASHINA, and his child was Tokitsune YAMASHINA; descent from the Tachibana clan
sen.cmt: YAMASHINAスペル訂正しました。スペース削除しました。descent from補足しました。clan小文字にしました。

sen.j: 多くの戦国大名との交友でも知られている。
sen.e: He was known for his friendship with daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period.
He was known for his friendship with daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period.
He was known for his friendship with daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period.

sen.j: 山科家は藤原北家四条家の分家である中御門家の庶流である。
sen.e: Yamashina family was the side line of the Nakanomikado family which was the branch family of Shijo family of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yamashina family was the side line of the Nakanomikado family which was a branch family of the Shijo family of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
Yamashina family was the side line of the Nakanomikado family which was a branch family of the Shijo family of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 羽林家の家格であったが戦国期には他の公家と同様不振の時代を迎えていた。
sen.e: He had the social standing of Urin family, but during the Sengoku period, he faced to a sluggish period as well as other court nobles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He held social standing as part of the Urin family, but during the Sengoku period, he faced a sluggish period together with other court nobles.
He held social standing as part of the Urin family, but during the Sengoku period, he faced a sluggish period together with other court nobles.

sen.j: 1548年には室町幕府によって代々の家領であった山科区が事実上横領される（天文17年5月25日）という事態に遭遇している。
sen.e: He experienced a de facto misappropriation of Yamashima Ward which had been the territory of YAMASHINA family for generations by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) on May 25, 1548.

He experienced a de facto misappropriation of Yamashima Ward which had been the territory of YAMASHINA family for generations by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) on May 25, 1548.

He experienced a de facto misappropriation of Yamashima Ward which had been the territory of Yamashina family for generations by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) on July 10, 1548.
sen.cmt: Yamashina小文字にしました。新暦に訂正しました。

sen.j: そのような時代の中で言継は家業である有職故実や笙、製薬のみならず、和歌（三条西公条の門下）、蹴鞠から漢方医学や酒宴、双六などの多彩な才能の持ち主であった。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, he was a person with versatile talents including Waka; he was a student of Kineda SANJONISHI, kemari (a game played by aristocrats in the Heian period), Chinese medicine, a feast, Sugoroku (Japanese backgammon), as well as Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) which was his family business, sho (Japanese flute) and medicine manufacture.

Under such circumstances, he was a person with versatile talents including Waka; he was a student of Kineda SANJONISHI, kemari (a game played by aristocrats in the Heian period), Chinese medicine, a feast, Sugoroku (Japanese backgammon), as well as Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) which was his family business, sho (Japanese flute) and medicine manufacture.

Under such circumstances, he was a person with versatile talents including Waka; he was a student of Kineda SANJONISHI, kemari (a game played by aristocrats in the Heian period), Chinese medicine, a feast, Sugoroku (Japanese backgammon), as well as Yusoku kojitsu (court and samurai rules of ceremony and etiquette) which was his family business, sho (Japanese flute) and medicine manufacture.

sen.j: だが、彼の持った最大の特技は「人脈作り」の才能であった。
sen.e: His most remarkable talent among them was `building up a network of connections.'
His most remarkable talent among them was `building up a network of connections.'
His most remarkable talent among them was `building up a network of connections.'

sen.j: 朝廷の財政の最高責任者である内蔵頭として、後奈良天皇・正親町天皇両天皇下で逼迫した財政の建て直しを図ることになる。
sen.e: He had to perform to reconstruct the finance pressed under the reigns of Emperor Gonara and Emperor Ogimachi as Kura no kami who is the financial general director of the imperial court.
He had to perform to reconstruct the finance pressed under the reigns of Emperor Gonara and Emperor Ogimachi as Kura no kami who was the financial general director of the imperial court.
He had to perform to reconstruct the finance pressed under the reigns of Emperor Gonara and Emperor Ogimachi as Kura no kami who was the financial general director of the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: Imperial Court大文字にしました。

sen.j: 当時の朝廷財政の収入の中で最大のものは諸大名からの献金であった。
sen.e: The greatest revenue of the finance of the imperial court at that time was a donation from daimyo.
The greatest soure of revenue for the imperial court at that time came from donations by daimyo.
The greatest source of revenue for the imperial court at that time came from donations by daimyo.

sen.j: 言継はその献金獲得のために各地を奔走することになった。
sen.e: Tokitsugu had to strive for getting the donation visiting many places.
Tokitsugu had to strive to get donations, and visited many places.
Tokitsugu had to strive to get donations, and visited many places.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: 既に1533年に歌舞音曲を扱う楽奉行として、尾張国の織田信秀を訪問した。
sen.e: In 1533, he visited Nobuhide ODA in Owari Province as Gaku bugyo that performs music and dance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。楽奉行→bugyo, assistant との登録がデータベースにありましたが少々不適切と考えより適切な用語を検討しましたが不明のため Gaku bugyo のみとしています。（追記）ご指摘ありがとうございました。楽奉行について再度Web でサーチしたところ、確固とした根拠が得られるサイトは見つからなかったのですが、総合的に判断して歌舞音曲を演奏すると判断して問題ないようでしたので左記のとおり補足しました。ご確認ください。「歌舞音曲を扱う」が訳出されていないようです。また "Gaku bugyo" だけでは、英語圏の方にはわからないと思いますので、簡単な補足をカッコで補っていただけますでしょうか。
sen.e: In 1533, he visited Nobuhide ODA in Owari Province as Gaku bugyo that performs music and dance.
In 1533, he visited Nobuhide ODA in Owari Province as Gaku bugyo that performs music and dance.

sen.j: 信秀や平手政秀以下の家臣団に和歌や蹴鞠の伝授を行って人脈を深め、後に天皇の即位式に対する信秀からの献金獲得の下均しを行った。
sen.e: He instructed Nobuhide or Nobuhide's vassals under Masahide HIRATE in Waka, Kemari to enhance the network of the connections, and later on, he negotiated the donation from Nobuhide for the enthronement ceremony for the emperor.

He instructed Nobuhide or Nobuhide's vassals under Masahide HIRATE in Waka, Kemari to enhance the network of connections, and later on, he negotiated a donation from Nobuhide towards the enthronement ceremony for the emperor.

He instructed Nobuhide or Nobuhide's vassals under Masahide HIRATE in Waka, Kemari to enhance the network of connections, and later on, he negotiated a donation from Nobuhide towards the enthronement ceremony for the emperor.

sen.j: 1556年には義理の叔母にあたる寿桂尼・今川義元親子を訪ねて駿河国を訪問し、献金の確約を得た。
sen.e: In 1556, he visited Jukei-ni who was his aunt-in-law and Yoshimoto IMAKAWA and Yoshimoto's mother in Suruga province to ensure their donations.
In 1556, he visited Jukei-ni who was his aunt-in-law and Yoshimoto IMAKAWA and Yoshimoto's mother in Suruga province to ensure their donations.
In 1556, he visited Jukei-ni who was his aunt-in-law and Yoshimoto IMAGAWA and Yoshimoto's mother in Suruga Province to ensure their donations.
sen.cmt: IMAGAWAに訂正しました。Province大文字にしました。

sen.j: 1566年には結城氏重臣の水谷正村に働きかけて御料所回復に成功し、その謝礼に正村の従五位下伊勢国国司への任官を推挙している。
sen.e: In 1556, he appealed Masamura MIZUNOYA, the senior vassal of Yuki clan, and succeeded to restore goryosho (the Imperial or shogunate's estate); he recommended to assign masamura to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Ise no kuni Kokushi (the governor of Ise Province) as a token of his appreciation.

In 1556, he appealed to Masamura MIZUNOYA, the senior vassal of Yuki clan, and succeeded in restoring goryosho (the Imperial or shogunate's estate); he recommended the assignment of Masamura to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Ise no kuni Kokushi (the governor of Ise Province) as a token of his appreciation.

In 1566, he appealed to Masamura MIZUNOYA, the senior vassal of Yuki clan, and succeeded in restoring goryosho (the Imperial or shogunate's estate); he recommended the assignment of Masamura to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Ise no kuni Kokushi (the governor of Ise Province) as a token of his appreciation.

sen.j: 言継の人脈作りの才能は決して上の方ばかりに向けられた訳ではなかった。
sen.e: Tokitsugu's talent to build up a network of connections was not always focused on the upper class.
Tokitsugu's talent to build up a network of connections was not always focused on the upper class.
Tokitsugu's talent to build up a network of connections was not always focused on the upper class.

sen.j: 言継はその気さくな人柄で庶民とともに入浴する事もあり、また優れた医療知識をもって天皇や公家達のみならず、京の庶民に対しても治療を行って、しかも無理に治療費を取る事がなかったため、言継は庶民からも人気がある公家となった。
sen.e: Tokitsugu's friendly character made him the court noble who was popular among common people; he sometimes took a bath with common people; he utilized his medical knowledge and treated not only an emperor or court nobles but also common people in Kyoto without charging them a treatment cost.

Tokitsugu's friendly character made him the court noble who was popular among common people; he sometimes took a bath with common people; he utilized his medical knowledge and treated not only the emperor or court nobles but also common people in Kyoto without charging them for the treatment.

Tokitsugu's friendly character made him the court noble who was popular among common people; he sometimes took a bath with common people; he utilized his medical knowledge and treated not only the emperor or court nobles but also common people in Kyoto without charging them for the treatment.

sen.j: 永禄の変後には、室町幕府第14代征夷大将軍足利義栄の将軍宣下の使者となるが、その当日に義栄の対抗馬である足利義昭からも正式な元服の実施と官位昇進要請の使者が来るという事件があった。
sen.e: After Eiroku Incident, he became an emissary proclaiming Yoshihide ASHIKAGA's assignment to the fourteenth seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of Muromachi bakufu, and on the same day, he was asked by Yoshiaki ASHIKAGAWA who is a rival to Yoshihide to perform an official Ganpuku ceremony and to request rank promotion for Yoshiaki through Yoshiaki's emissary.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After the Eiroku Incident, he became an emissary proclaiming Yoshihide ASHIKAGA's assignment to the fourteenth seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Muromachi bakufu, and on the same day, he was asked by Yoshiaki ASHIKAGAWA who was a rival to Yoshihide to perform an official Ganpuku ceremony and request rank promotion for Yoshiaki through Yoshiaki's emissary.

After the Eiroku Incident, he became an emissary proclaiming Yoshihide ASHIKAGA's assignment to the fourteenth seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Muromachi bakufu, and on the same day, he was asked by Yoshiaki ASHIKAGAWA who was a rival to Yoshihide to perform an official Ganpuku ceremony and request rank promotion for Yoshiaki through Yoshiaki's emissary.

sen.j: 言継はこの事態に困惑しつつも臆せずこの要請を受ける返事をした後に仕度をして義栄のいる摂津国に向かっている（なお、昇進要請はその後却下され、元服の方も義昭が独自に行っている）。
sen.e: Tokitsugu was confused in this situation, but got ready himself to go to Settsu Province in which Yoshihide lived after accepting Yoshiaki's request (subsequently, the request for Yoshiaki's promotion was rejected, and Yoshiaki went through Genpuku ceremony himself).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Tokitsugu was confused by this situation, but readied himself to go to Settsu Province in which Yoshihide lived after accepting Yoshiaki's request (subsequently, the request for Yoshiaki's promotion was rejected, and Yoshiaki went through Genpuku ceremony himself).

Tokitsugu was confused by this situation, but readied himself to go to Settsu Province in which Yoshihide lived after accepting Yoshiaki's request (subsequently, the request for Yoshiaki's promotion was rejected, and Yoshiaki went through Genpuku ceremony himself).

sen.j: 後に義昭が織田信長に擁されて上洛した際に、義昭は前将軍義栄就任の責任者の処分を朝廷に要求した。
sen.e: When Yoshiaki was backed up by Nobunaga ODA and went up to Kyoto, Yoshiaki demanded for the disciplinary action for the responsible person for the assignment of Yoshihide to the former Syogun.
When Yoshiaki was backed by Nobunaga ODA and went to Kyoto, he demanded disciplinary action towards the person responsible for assigning Yoshihide to the former Shogun.
When Yoshiaki was backed by Nobunaga ODA and went to Kyoto, he demanded disciplinary action towards the person responsible for assigning Yoshihide to the former Shogun.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: 言継は使者を務めた自分がその一番の責任者に挙げられると考えて自宅に謹慎していた。
sen.e: First, he was afraid to be specified as the most responsible person who served as the emissary and stayed at home.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: First, he was afraid as being named as the most responsible person who served as emissary, and stayed at home.
First, he was afraid as being named as the most responsible person who served as emissary, and stayed at home.

sen.j: しかしながら、義昭からは先の仲介を理由に不問とされ、代わりに将軍宣下の儀の手伝いを要請され、信長の家臣村井貞勝らに装束に関する指導を行っている。
sen.e: However, he was requested to help the ceremony for imperial proclamation of Syogun without being charged, for that he had helped Yoshiaki requesting Yoshiak's promotion, and he instructed Nobunaga's vassals including Sadakatsu MURAI on their outfits.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, he was requested to help the ceremonial imperial proclamation of Shogun without being charged, for that he had helped Yoshiaki requesting Yoshiak's promotion, and he instructed Nobunaga's vassals including Sadakatsu MURAI on their outfits.
sen.cmt: Robert: "for that he had helped Yoshiaki requesting Yoshiak's promotion, " doesn't make sense
sen.e: However, he was requested to help the ceremonial imperial proclamation of Shogun without being charged, for that he had helped Yoshiaki requesting Yoshiak's promotion, and he instructed Nobunaga's vassals including Sadakatsu MURAI on their outfits.

sen.j: 晩年には山科家では初めて権大納言（1569年）に昇進し、織田信長との交渉役としても活躍した。
sen.e: Later in his life he promoted to Gon Dainagon as the first person in YAMASHINA family's (in 1569), and took an active role of negotiation with Nobunaga ODA.
Later in his life he was promoted to Gon Dainagon as the first person in YAMASHINA family's (in 1569), and took an active role in negotiation with Nobunaga ODA.
Later in his life he was promoted to Gon Dainagon as the first person in the Yamashina family (in 1569), and took an active role in negotiation with Nobunaga ODA.
sen.cmt: the補足しました。Yamashina小文字にしました。's削除しました。

sen.j: 信長もこの年に二条城築城視察の帰りに山科邸を訪問している。
sen.e: Nobunaga also visited the residence of YAMASHINA on the way back from his visitation of Nijo Castle in the same year.
Nobunaga also visited the residence of YAMASHINA on the way back from his visitation of Nijo Castle in the same year.
Nobunaga also visited the residence of Yamashina on the way back from his visitation of Nijo Castle in the same year.

sen.j: 著書としては自撰歌集『言継卿集』（『拾翠愚草抄』（1527年 - 1541年）と『権大納言言継卿集』（1562年 - 1574年）から成り立つ）と日記『言継卿記』がある。
sen.e: His books including: collection of poem selected by him, "Collection of High Courtier Tokitsugu"(consists of "拾翠愚草抄"(1527-1541) and "Collection of Gondainagon Tokitsugu" (1562-1574); his diary, "Tokitsugu Kyoki".
sen.cmt: 拾翠愚草抄→定訳・読み方ともに不明です。
sen.e: His books include: collection of poem selected by him, "Collection of High Courtier Tokitsugu"(consists of "拾翠愚草抄"(1527-1541) and "Collection of Gondainagon Tokitsugu" (1562-1574); his diary, "Tokitsugu Kyoki".

His books include: collection of poem selected by him, "Collection of High Courtier Tokitsugu" (consists of "Shusui Gusosho" (1527 - 1541) and "Collection of Gon dainagon Tokitsugu" (1562 - 1574); his diary, "Tokitsugu Kyoki."
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。拾翠愚草抄、読みのローマ字表記を記載しました。ピリオド位置訂正しました。

sen.j: 特に後者は大永7年（1527年）から天正4年（1576年）にかけての50年の長期にわたって記されており、当時の公家や戦国大名たちや上泉信綱などの動向が詳細に記されている。
sen.e: The latter was recorded spending fifty years (1527-1576), and it reported on court nobles, daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period, and Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI in detail.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The latter was recorded over the course of fifty years (1527-1576), and it was reported by court nobles, daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period, and Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI in detail.
The latter was recorded over the course of fifty years (1527 - 1576), and it was reported by court nobles, daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period, and Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI in detail.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。

sen.j: また、彼自身が治療に携わった医療行為に関する詳細な記録も残されており、現存する日本で最古のまとまった診療録であるとも言われている。
sen.e: Furthermore, it recorded details of medical practices he performed, thus it is said that "Tokitsugu Kyoki" is the oldest medical record that exists in large volume in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Furthermore, it recorded details on medical practices he performed, thus it is said that "Tokitsugu Kyoki" is the oldest medical record that exists in high volume format in Japan.
Furthermore, it recorded details on medical practices he performed, thus it is said that "Tokitsugu Kyoki" is the oldest medical record that exists in high volume format in Japan.

sen.j: 死後300年以上経た1915年11月に朝廷の財政と対外交渉にあたって朝廷の存続に尽くした功績をもって従一位という破格の贈位が行われたのも、まさに彼の財政手腕と人格の為せる業であったと言える。
sen.e: It was his financial skill and personality that made it possible to grant him an incredible rank, Juichii (Junior First Rank) in November, 1915, after more than 300 years passed after his death, for his work dedicated on continuance of the imperial court taking charge of finance and external negotiation for the imperial court.

It was his financial skill and personality that allowed him to be granted the incredible rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank) in November, 1915, more than 300 years after after his death, for his work dedicated towards continuing the imperial court and taking charge of finance and external negotiation.

It was his financial skill and personality that allowed him to be granted the incredible rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank) in November, 1915, more than 300 years after his death, for his work dedicated towards continuing the Imperial Court and taking charge of finance and external negotiation.
sen.cmt: 余分なafter削除しました。Imperial Court大文字にしました。
